item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: How to Get Wyvernsprouts
item.description:
Monster Hunter Wilds features various items that can be used in just as many ways. Some can be obtained naturally through gameplay, while others may require some extra effort and knowledge of the world around you.

While exploring through Monster Hunter Wilds , items can be found almost everywhere you look. If they cannot be taken from the world, then they can come from monsters after they are hunted. While it can be simple, in most cases, some items need to have the right conditions met as time passes naturally. One of these items is the Wyvernsprout .

How to Get a Wyvernsprout

A Wyvernsprout is a rare special item that can be used as a trading item with some vendors. To obtain it, you must first successfully kill any small monster . Through testing, the best monster to hunt for this item is a Ceratonoth , since they are always in large herds. This gives you multiple chances to get this item to spawn , since the spawn rates can be rare at times. They are most commonly found in the Windward Plains around Zone 8 .

Upon killing a Ceratonoth, or any small monster, do not carve it immediately. About 5 or 6 minutes needs to pass in order for the Wyvernsprout to actually sprout from the corpse. Carving the corpse before that happens will remove the chance of the Wyvernsprout spawning . You will know the corpse has become rotten once its name changes to specify it as rotten along with a green skull next to the interact button .

The Wyvernsprout will typically sprout from the corpse's head , and the body will start to develop this fuzzy-like coating around it , further signifying that it has gone rotten. If this does not occur, repeat the previous steps until this occurs.

Once you see the Wyvernsprout, simply interact with the sprout, and you will begin a unique animation while harvesting it. This item can be sold, but is more valuable for trading with Sekka if she has items you may be looking for on your journeys. This item is also required to be obtained once if anyone is looking to get the Explorer of the Eastland achievement.

item.title: Genshin Impact: Iansan Constellation Guide
item.description:
Iansan is surprisingly a very good 4-star character in Genshin Impact . Her ability to buff ATK% and heal the active character makes her a reliable ally who fits into many teams. But that’s not all that Iansan is capable of. When unlocking her Constellations, Iansan’s role as a support greatly improves, making her a must-have for some teams, instead of just good enough.

As a 4-star character, it’s easier to unlock Iansan’s Constellations and maximize her supportive potential. For that, this guide will go through Iansan’s Constellations in Genshin Impact and check if they’re worth unlocking or not.

Are Iansan’s Constellations Worth It In Genshin Impact?

Yes, Iansan’s Constellations are worth it in Genshin Impact . While Iansan is a great 4-star unit without her Constellations, she still gains so much value from every one of them, especially her second and sixth Constellations. Both her second and sixth copies give her an extra buff that will increase her viability as a buffer in Genshin Impact .

C1 - Starting's Never Easy

Effect

When Iansan is in combat and is in the Nightsoul's Blessing state, she will restore 15 Elemental Energy for every 6 Nightsoul points she consumes. This effect can trigger once every 18s.

Importance

High

Without her Elemental Burst in Genshin Impact , Iansan couldn’t really fulfill any of her supportive roles. For that, regenerating her Elemental Burst back on every rotation should be the top priority for every player building her. Luckily, Iansan’s C1 solves a part of this necessity by giving her 15 Energy on every rotation. Now it’s much easier for Iansan to cast her Elemental Burst and have one of the smoothest gameplays in the game.

C2 - Laziness is the Enemy!

Effect

When using the Elemental Burst The Three Principles of Power, Iansan will also gain the Precise Movement effect from her Passive Talent "Enhanced Resistance Training" for 15s. Additionally, if Iansan is off-field while Precise Movement is active, she will also increase your current active character's ATK by 30%. You must first unlock the Passive Talent "Enhanced Resistance Training" to access the above effect.

Importance

Priority

Iansan without Constellation has a lonely ATK% buff for the active character in her team. It’s a good buff and validates Iansan as a 4-star character in Genshin Impact , but it’s not her full potential. When unlocking her C2, she will unlock an additional 30% ATK buff to add to her kit. This makes her a reliable buffer for every character with a high Base ATK in the game.

C4 - Slow and Steady Wins the Race

Effect

When the Kinetic Energy Scale is present, Iansan will gain 2 stacks of Surging Force after your current active character (excluding herself) uses their Elemental Burst. The stacks last until the Scale leaves the field, and Surging Force can be gained once per Scale summoning. Whenever Iansan restores Nightsoul points via the Scale, she will consume 1 Surging Force stack and restore 4 additional Nightsoul points. Additionally, if her Nightsoul restoration from the Scale overflows, Iansan will gain 50% of the overflow the next time she restores Nightsoul points via the Scale.

Importance

High

Constellation number four improves Iansan’s Nightsoul restoration, which further maintains her off-field ATK buff. It also unlocks the ability for her Nightsoul restoration to overflow, giving her two great benefits from this new passive effect. She will have an easier time staying on her second rotation and will be able to trigger her C6 effect constantly, which increases the active character’s DMG by 25%.

C6 - Teachings of the Collective of Plenty

Effect

The Kinetic Energy Scale's duration is increased by 3s.

Additionally, when Iansan triggers Nightsoul point restoration, if there is any overflow, she will gain the Extreme Force effect, which increases the DMG dealt by your current active character by 25% for 3s.

Importance

Priority

As a buffer, it’s important to have as many buffs in Iansan’s kit as possible. For that, it’s very important to unlock her C6 since it increases the duration of her buff while also granting her a new 25% DMG buff. That alone puts Iansan among the best supports in Genshin Impact .

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 - 6 Ways To Make The Game Harder
item.description:
Summary

  • Use mods to increase difficulty and make the AI stronger or Henry weaker.
  • Avoid OP perks, and don't steal or loot enemies to prevent gathering too much wealth.
  • Don't use swords and instead challenge yourself with weaker melee weapons or ranged options.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has taken the gaming world by storm and serves as a prime example of how RPGs should be made. However, while the game's difficulty is fine for most players, some may find aspects of it too easy, especially in the latter stages after Henry has leveled up and acquired the best gear.

To that end, the following are some ideas on how to make KCD2 more challenging , either by changing things within the game or by enforcing self-made rules.

6 Hardcore Mode

Negative Perks, Limited HUD & Map, Plus Much More

While KCD2 does not have difficulty modes in the traditional manner where stats are raised or lowered, hardcore mode is on the way and can even be unlocked in an unofficial way for PC players. Similarly to the first game, the first step of hardcore mode is choosing negative Perks, which may make Henry learn at a slower pace or sleepwalk so that he wakes up in different beds.

Upon getting into the game, players will also notice that most of the HUD is gone, meaning they won't know when they are low on health or when enemies are attacking, forcing them to use their eyes and ears. Henry's location on the map will also be hidden, making navigation much harder. Other mechanics and stats will also be rebalanced, creating an overall tougher experience.

5 Use Mods That Increase Difficulty

These Can Make The AI Stronger Or Henry Weaker & Tweak Values

PC players have a natural advantage when it comes to making the game harder, as they have access to gameplay mods that increase the difficulty. For example, there are mods to reduce the nutritional value of food, or combat mods that make the AI's attacks better.

There are also mods to make Henry weaker by lowering his level at the start of the game or by reducing the rate at which he gains XP. As the modding scene continues to grow after the release of official modding support, players may see more ambitious projects in the future that overhaul larger parts of the difficulty. Thankfully, most of these mods are easy to install on the Steam Workshop.

4 Don't Use Potions

Especially The Ones Which Boost Henry's Stats

While Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 is known for immersion and historical accuracy, gameplay always has to come first, and that means bending a few realism rules. Potions in KCD2 are mostly unrealistic, certainly with how fast they act, but they complement the gameplay and open up the fun of alchemy.

However, players looking for challenge runs in KCD2 can either entirely or mostly avoid potions. For example, players may continue to take a Chamomile Brew before bed to heal better over the night, as this seems fair and realistic as a herbal remedy. The ones to avoid for increased difficulty are those that grant stat boosts, such as to Henry's strength or thievery skill.

3 Avoid OP Perks Or Don't Take Them At All

Some Perks Are Too Strong, Or Render Some Mechanics Useless

One way to make KCD2 harder is to simply make Henry weaker. This can be achieved by not unlocking certain strong Perks or by avoiding them altogether. While Henry will still continue to level up his stats, increasing his stamina and the like, he won't get access to overpowered effects and abilities.

For example, the Ascetic Perk decreases Henry's hunger needs, which are already fairly low, meaning players will almost never struggle for food, nullifying an interesting survival mechanic. Similarly, there are a few Perks that stop Henry from losing as much energy, which means he doesn't need a realistic amount of sleep. If players find combat too easy, avoid certain Warfare Perks or ones tailored for specific weapon types. If players have already unlocked loads of skills, they can respec their Perks by drinking Lethean Water.

2 Don't Steal & Don't Loot Enemies

This Will Prevent Players From Becoming Rich & Getting The Best Gear

One of the main reasons why the late game of KCD2 can feel too easy is that Henry will often have the best gear and so much money that it becomes trivial. To prevent this, players can try to only earn money in honest ways. This not only means refraining from thievery, but also for looting the corpses of bandits and fallen soldiers.

Players can instead try to earn Groschen via blacksmithing, alchemy, or by helping others through quests. This can lead to more interesting gameplay where players may have to gamble their last few coins in order to afford a bed for the night or food. It will also mean Henry cannot afford the best armor and weapons, making him weaker in combat.

1 Don't Use Swords

Swords Are A Tad Overpowered Compared With Other Weapons

Another way to make KCD2 feel more challenging is to avoid the use of swords, as they seem to be stronger than other weapon types. Instead, try to beat the game using weaker axes, maces, or polearms. Players could also try to make better use of ranged weapons if they've mostly relied on melee weapons previously.

Choosing weaker versions of these weapons can also add to the challenge, and if players are implementing other self imposed rules that impact their income, this may happen naturally.

item.title: Genshin Impact: Varesa Constellation Guide
item.description:
Varesa is a strong main DPS who relies on her Plunge attacks to deal DMG in Genshin Impact . Unlike Xiao, Varesa has easy access to her Plunge attacks. Simply cast her Elemental Skill or Charge attack to launch Varesa in the air, and then she can easily use her Plunge attack.

As a limited 5-star character in Genshin Impact , it’s not easy to obtain Varesa herself, let alone her Constellations. So, for players who are willing to pull for Varesa multiple times and collect her Constellations, it’s important to know if it’s worth it or not to pull for Varesa’s Constellations in Genshin Impact .

Are Varesa’s Constellations Worth It In Genshin Impact?

No, Varesa’s Constellations are not worth it in Genshin Impact , especially since she's already sufficient at C0. While all her Constellations focus on buffing and improving her Plunge attacks, they do so slowly, and you won’t feel the difference until you reach her sixth Constellation. Once you open all Constellations, Varesa will gain an insane amount of extra DMG, but at an insane cost as well.

If you're determined to get some of Varesa's Constellation, then it's best to stop at C2 if not going all the way to C6 .

C1 - Undying Passion

Effect

The effects of the Passive Talent "Tag-Team Triple Jump!" are enhanced:

When performing the Special Plunging Attack "Thunderous Tornado Eruption," Varesa will also gain "Rainbow Crash" for 5s.

When "Rainbow Crash" is in effect, Varesa's Plunging Attack ground impact DMG is increased by 180% of her ATK, whether she is in the Fiery Passion state or not. You must first unlock the Passive Talent "Tag-Team Triple Jump!" to access the above effect.

Additionally, when Varesa is in the Sudden Onrush mode of her Nightsoul's Blessing, she consumes 30% less Nightsoul points or Phlogiston.

Importance

Low

The first Constellation for Varesa adds an extra DMG to her Plunge attacks, which is not bad but not really groundbreaking. Having an extra 180% DMG on every Plunge attack is not really worth it.

C2 - Beyond the Edge of Light

Effect

Varesa will enter Apex Drive after using a Plunging Attack, regardless of whether she is in the Fiery Passion state or not.

When Apex Drive is active, Varesa's interruption resistance will also further increase.

Additionally, Varesa will restore 11.5 Energy when her Plunging Attack ground impact hits an opponent.

Importance

High

C2 Varesa allows her to stay in the Apex Drive state as long as she keeps Plunge attacking enemies. Not only that, but she also restores a decent amount of Energy on every Plunge, which notably increases how frequently she can cast her Elemental Burst in her Apex Drive State. The second Constellation of Varesa greatly improves her DMG and allows her to stay on the field for longer durations without losing DPS.

C4 - The Courage to Press On

Effect

Varesa will receive various buffs based on her state when using her Elemental Burst Guardian Vent! If Varesa:

  • Has neither Fiery Passion nor Apex Drive active, she will gain Diligent Refinement for 15s, which will increase her Plunging Attack ground impact DMG by 500% of her ATK, with a maximum increase of 20,000 DMG. This effect will be canceled once the ground impact hits an opponent, or if its duration ends.
  • If she has either Fiery Passion or Apex Drive active, this instance of her Elemental Burst Guardian Vent! Deals 100% increased DMG.

Importance

Medium

C4 Varesa also adds a lot of DMG to her Plunge attacks, which is good for her kit. However, as a fourth Constellation, you’re risking a lot of pulls and Standard banner 5-star characters to have Varesa’s Elemental Burst buffed by 100% increased DMG. Yes, the first part is nice, but Varesa can’t frequently trigger it, or else this Constellation is a priority to unlock for Varesa in Genshin Impact .

C6 - A Hero of Justice's Triumph

Effect

Varesa restores 30 Energy when she enters Apex Drive.

Her Plunging Attacks and Elemental Burst Guardian Vent! Gain 10% CRIT Rate and 100% CRIT DMG.

Additionally, when Varesa uses the Hold version of her Elemental Skill Riding the Night-Rainbow, or Taps her Elemental Skill while in the Sudden Onrush mode, she will restore Nightsoul points up to her maximum.

Importance

Priority

Varesa heavily relies on her Plunge attacks to deal DMG in Genshin Impact . A Constellation that buffs Varesa’s Plunge attacks and Elemental Burst by adding more Crit value to them is always going to be a priority. Not only that, but on C6, Varesa will regenerate the full amount of energy needed to spam her Elemental Burst when she enters her Apex Drive state. Remember that C2 Varesa already enters the Apex Drive state every time she Plunge attacks, which makes Varesa able to cast her Elemental Burst after every single Plunge. That’s an insane amount of extra DMG for Varesa’s kit in Genshin Impact .

item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth: 8 Best Mods For Yuffie
item.description:
Summary

  • Certain Yuffie mods focus on appearance changes and gameplay tweaks in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth.
  • Mods can even offer texture upscale, outfit alterations, and bilingual voice options for Yuffie.
  • Some of the best mod options for Yuffie include new hair colors, an Advent Children outfit swap, and AI improvements.

Ninja and thief Yuffie Kisaragi is introduced in the remake of Final Fantasy 7 via her own episode in Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade , where she takes center stage as the protagonist. She then becomes a party member in the sequel, Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth . There are several mods available for Yuffie for her solo outing in Intergrade , but most of the mods for her revolve around her appearance in Rebirth , as this is when she becomes part of the main cast of characters.

Some truly great mods center around Yuffie in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth . Most of these mods are cosmetic, but there is also a fun gameplay mechanic mod available that works on Yuffie as well as the other members of the party. For those looking to help this Wutai warrior stand out during their playthrough, here are some of the best Yuffie mods in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth .

8 Yuffie Gold Saucer Dress Recolors

Over 4,200 Downloads

  • Mod link
  • Created by vxsapphire

There is a section of Rebirth wherein the player will go on a date with the character who is closest to Cloud. The date takes place in the Gold Saucer, a hub chock-full of fun mini-games. Yuffie can be the one to join the player on this date, but it is difficult to raise the relationship with her to that extent at that point in the game, as she hasn't been part of the team for that long. If players do have Yuffie with them, she will wear a special dress, also known as the Wutai Pop Star dress. This mod offers more choices regarding Yuffie’s dress, providing four additional retextures.

There are two darker texture choices, one with a cream, dark blue, and red color scheme and another with a white, navy, and light blue look. There are also two paler choices, one pink and one cream. To use the mod, players will either need to beat the game, as finishing the story unlocks the dress in the wardrobe, or have a mod installed that lets them use the dress immediately.

7 Yuffie4K Upscaled Textures

Over 7,300 Downloads

  • Mod link
  • Created by Romi

The Yuffie4K Upscaled Textures mod does what the name suggests: It offers a 4K resolution texture upscale for Yuffie’s standard outfit. This makes a big difference to Yuffie’s visuals, giving her a more defined look.

It's a great mod for those looking for better graphics and visuals for Yuffie, but players should be warned that it isn’t compatible with other texture mods, aside from that of eye, skin, or hair mods.

6 Yuffie Tweaks

Over 2,800 Downloads

  • Mod link
  • Created by e_resh

Yuffie Tweaks is a mod that enhances the textures of Yuffie’s outfit, but it also offers some alterations to her character model. This is different from some of the other popular texture mods, as it completely changes the character model to remove certain items.

Some of the tweaks currently available with this mod include changes to the colors of Yuffie's standard outfit and the removal of the arm cover armor that she wears with her regular outfit and with her Moogle outfit.

5 Yuffie Intergrade Look

Over 2,800 Downloads

  • Mod link
  • Created by ardwall

As mentioned, Yuffie is first introduced in an additional episode called Episode INTERmission in Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade . For those who are fans of Yuffie’s look from Intergrade , this mod is a great choice.

The mod updates the standard model for Yuffie from Rebirth and incorporates elements of her design from Intergrade . It also combines some of the physics found in the Intergrade outfit with the one featured in Rebirth .

4 Bilingual Yuffie (Japanese And English)

Over 1,820 Downloads

  • Mod link
  • Created by Nttnnexus

This Bilingual Yuffie (Japanese and English) mod is an interesting one, as it is not cosmetic or gameplay-related. Instead, it is a voice-related mod that makes Yuffie bilingual. Yuffie hails from the fictional land of Wutai in the Final Fantasy universe, and this mod makes Japanese the primary language of Wutai.

When installed, Yuffie becomes bilingual and will switch between her native Wutai language –Japanese– and English. The mod is unique, but it is also well-detailed, featuring a dual subtitle system and full voice integration. It's a mod that adds an extra layer of depth to Yuffie as a character, giving her a bilingual skill that makes sense from a story perspective.

3 Most Combative Team Members

Over 35,300 Downloads

  • Mod link
  • Created by Gantz79

Many players tend to take issue with the AI behavior of the companions in both Final Fantasy 7 Remake and Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , as characters will sometimes stand around aimlessly rather than attack in combat. This mod aims to rectify that, making party members –including Yuffie– more aggressive and combative.

The team members in Rebirth will attack more often when this mod is active, though they will not neglect their defense during battle. This is a handy mod for those frustrated with companion behavior, even if it isn’t specifically related to Yuffie (though it does apply to her).

2 Yuffie Advent Children Reborn

Over 3,100 Downloads

  • Mod link
  • Created by Ninjagrime

Final Fantasy 7: Advent Children is a popular animated movie from 2005 that takes place two years after the events of the original Final Fantasy 7 game. It’s a popular film among fans, so it’s no surprise that there are mods for most of the characters that give them their outfits from the movie. Yuffie is no exception, and that’s what players get here.

This mod dresses Yuffie in the clothes that she wears in Advent Children , making it a great choice for fans of the film. It's also a mod that works well with the other Advent Children -themed mods.

1 Yuffie’s Vivid And Natural Solid Color Hair Collection

Over 2,120 Downloads

  • Mod link
  • Created by TirienMods

Those who want to customize Yuffie’s hair can do so with ease with this next mod, which offers 23 new hair colors for her. There is a range of available hair colors that come with this mod, including natural colors, such as peach blonde, light brown, and ginger red, and more out there, anime-style colors, like pastel pink, sea green, and light blue.

Players can change Yuffie’s hair color as often as they please with this mod, making it a great option for customization. For those looking to help Yuffie stand out from the rest of the party, this mod will also help them do just that.
